description: The 3 miles of trails in Bird Hills give some lovely views of the Huron River. This is the largest Nature Area in Ann Arbor, and provides a great space to get out and see wildlife and wildflowers. Volunteers are needed to help maintain the trails throughout the park. This is a great workday for the family. Join us at the Bird Road entrance on the north side of this park, west of Huron River Drive. There is limited parking at the entrance, but more nearby at the Barton Nature Area entrance on Huron River Drive. Please wear long pants and closed-toe shoes. All minors must present a completed release form, and should be accompanied by a guardian. Tools, snacks, and know-how provided. Free.
name: Bird Hills Park Stewardship Workday-National Trails Day

description: We're celebrating this weekend's $3.99/lb bacon sale (crazy, right?!) with a special BLT. For just a buck an inch, you get our made in house Bacon, Lettuce, and Tomato sandwich. Don't go bacon our heart and miss this!
name: BLT by the Inch

description:
Come join us for the Intuitives Interactive Holistic & Psychic Expo! The largest event of its kind in Michigan!
NOW TWO DAYS LONG! Saturday-Sunday, June 4-5, 2016

NEW LOCATION: 
The beautiful EMU Student Center
Eastern Michigan University in Ypsilanti (next-door to Ann Arbor)
900 Oakwood Street, 2nd floor Ballroom and Auditorium 
(ground floor as you enter from the parking lot)
Ypsilanti, MI 48197

SPONSORED BY: Body Mind Spirit Guide & Body Mind Spirit Radio, Crazy Wisdom Bookstore & Tea Room, and the Enlightened Soul Center

SATURDAY, JUNE 4, 2016 - 10:00 am - 8:00 pm
Doors open 9:30 am for registration on Saturday.
SUNDAY, JUNE 5, 2016 - 11:00 am - 5:00 pm
Doors open 10:30 am for registration on Sunday

ADMISSION: 
$10 for one day or 
$15 for a weekend pass
Kids 12-18 yrs: $5 daily pass / Under 12 free 
Includes FREE presentations! 
FREE PARKING at designated lots

READINGS: There will be Mediums, Psychics, Tarot & Angel Card Readers, Intuitive & Channeled Readings, Palm Readings. 
SPECIALTY READINGS: Crystal Ball, Rare Hungarian Gypsy Cards, Runes, Numerology, Shamanic Stone Bowl...and more!
DETAILS: http://www.holisticpsychicexpo.com/#!readers/e75ww

OTHER GREAT OFFERINGS INCLUDE: Aura Photography, Body & Energy Workers, Vendors of Holistic & Metaphysical Products, and More!
DETAILS: http://www.holisticpsychicexpo.com/#!vendors/tcvqd

FEATURED PRESENTATION: 
6:30 PM SATURDAY - "Michigan Mediums: Group Gallery Reading Extravaganza" Three mediums who'll share the stage to connect the audience members with their departed loved ones: Marybeth Rombach Nelson, Kathy Tertzag, and Tom Pierce.

SCHEDULE of FREE PRESENTATIONS:
DETAILS: http://www.holisticpsychicexpo.com/#!speakers/uoauv

SATURDAY, JUNE 4:
11:00 am-12:00 pm - Juliana Schriemer
"Conscious Nutrition: Cultivating Intuition & More"
12:30-1:30 pm - Steve Schriemer
“Expanding Awareness Through Qi Gong”
2:00-3:00 pm - Christine Fodor
"Embodying Your Higher Self: Clearing the Ego"
3:30-4:30 pm - Sue Burton Hidalgo
“The House Whisperer - Feng Shui and More”
5:00-6:00 pm - Constance Hart, ND
"Rahanni Celestial Healing"
6:30-8:00 pm
"Michigan Mediums" - Group Gallery Reading Extravaganza with Marybeth Rombach Nelson, Kathy Tertzag, and Tom Pierce

SUNDAY, JUNE 5:
11:30 am-12:30 pm - Lynda Forbes
"Chinese Face-Reading: Your Health Is Written On Your Face"
1:00-2:00 pm - Wendy Piepenberg
"Mediumship Gallery Reading with Departed Loved Ones"
2:30-3:30 pm - Daphne Mead-Derbyshire
"Tidbits & Tips for the Spiritual Explorer" 
4:00-5:00 pm - Allegra Miller
"Healing Oils of the Bible"

VOLUNTEERS NEEDED! Volunteers get special perks in exchange for their dedicated service. Apply at http://www.holisticpsychicexpo.com/#!volunteer/glc6s

MAILING LIST: Join our mailing list by filling out the form at:
http://holisticpsychicexpo.com

TO APPLY FOR A BOOTH as a reader, bodyworker, or vendor:   http://holisticpsychicexpo.com - click on "Apply" in the menu.
APPLICATION DEADLINE: Friday, May 6
Late applications will be accepted until we are full, but may not be included in the program book.

Thanks and we look forward to seeing YOU and your friends at this transformative event!!!

Sunflower painting courtesy of Molly Indura, bethelight.org
name: Holistic & Psychic Expo, June 4-5, 2016

description: Join us on the 4th and 5th under the big tent.  Over 30 ceramic artists offering handmade works that range from dinnerware and  fuctional work to home decor, tiles and jewelery.  Find that perfect wedding or graduation gift!
name: Potters Guild Spring Sale

description:
There’s a new trail at this park! We’ve made great progress restoring native wildflowers here, and now they are easier to get to. Help continue this effort by removing invasive plants and working to maintain the trails. Please meet at the Gallup boat launch parking lot, on the SE corner of Huron Parkway and Geddes Road.
Please wear long pants and closed-toe shoes. All minors must present a completed release form, and should be accompanied by a guardian. Tools, snacks, and know-how provided. Free.
name: Ruthven Park Steward Workday-National Trails Day

description:
Join the artists of Instructor Show to learn about their process and artworks from the exhibition. Free and open to the public.

---------

The 117 Gallery 2015/2016 season is supported by Vintage Financial Services LLC
name: Artist Talk - Instructor Show

description:
Did you know that babo now offers craft cocktails along with craft beer and various varietals of wine?

Every Monday through Friday we will be offering 20% off our signature cocktails, draft beers, and wine by the glass for Happy Hour.

So take this time to Treat yo' self!
name: Happy Hour at babo

description:
Come join us for Discotech Heroes Debut Ann Arbor performance at Club Above!

18+ 

5$ Until 10pm
7$ After


___________________________________________________
Discotech Heroes-
Disco is back in the form of the Discotech Heroes. Hailing from Ohio, the birthplace of funk, Jon and Paul have brought the old school funk and groove back in their own way by blending sounds from the past and beats from the present to create their own unique style. Before Discotech Heroes was born, Jon and Paul have been DJing individually and have a combined 20+ years of experience performing at some of the nations most respected venues and opening up for some of the largest acts in EDM.

The Discotech Heroes have opened up for artists such as Hermitude, Snails, Jauz, Mija, Ghastly, Zomboy, Illenium, and The Funk Hunters just to name a few.

The Discotech Heroes believe the distant past is the future of EDM. Let’s get funky!

MEDIA

http://www.facebook.com/discotechheroes
http://www.twitter.com/discotechheroes
http://www.instagram.com/discotechheroes
http://www.soundcloud.com/discotechheroes
___________________________________________________
Cass Wasacz-
	Cameron “Cass” Wasacz is a 21 year old DJ/Music Producer, Drummer, and Lighting Specialist. Raised in Detroit, MI, Cam infuses his love for Metal/Rock/Funk with electronic production. And not only stops at sound design but brings the full show to his live performances with a spectacular lighting experience. He’s transformed the underground scene with his lighting company ProLux Entertainment. Allowing upcoming bands, rappers and produces like himself to experience the next level during their performances. 

      Cass has supported many names that have made their way through michigan including: Kayzo, Liquid Stranger, Jackal, Party Thieves, Vaski, MUST DIE!, TrollPhace, Eptic and soon to include DiscoTech Heroes!

Media:
https://wasaczmusic.wix.com/home
https://soundcloud.com/casswasacz
https://www.facebook.com/Cass-Wasacz-466380480198479/
___________________________________________________

Quack Attak
DïRTYBLÜR
[WADE]
Play Day x CHöFF
Cass

9-9:45 - Play Day x CHöFF
9:45-10:30 - [WADE]
10:30-11:15 - Quack Attak
11:15-12 - Cass Wasacz
12-1:25 - Discotech Heroes
